title: Edinburgh/Old Town
name: The Scottish Parliament
directions: eastern end of the Royal Mile, opposite the Palace of Holyrood House
content: A unique building (designed by the Spanish (Catalan) architect Enric Miralles) with a Â£431 million price tag which is much higher than the original back-of-an-envelope estimate. Highly controversial among Scots, who consider it either a daring showpiece of postmodern architecture or a national embarrassment. Free access to an exhibition, and the Debating Chamber on non-business days. It is necessary to get (free) tickets to watch the Parliament in session from the Public Gallery.
